column4: ok obviously no one here can give me the help I really need...
what is your Q again

During install of ubuntu server (alternate CD) when booting from the CD it says it can't detect any common CD-ROM drives. I do not have any floppy disks I can use for a netboot, and I have no USB stick. this installation *must* be done from a CD
did you try mounting the CD from the command line?
i would if it was listed in /dev but /dev/cdrom doesn't exist
is it IDE ?
it's atapi according to my bios, but it is connected to a standard IDE interface
try /dev/hdb, /dev/hdc, etc..
those are hard drives
nothing starting with hd shows in /dev either.
I'm looking at the /dev list. if you give me about 10-15 mins or so I can provide a paste of the entire /dev list as detected by the installer to get idea
ls /etc/ > ~/list.etc
what am I supposed to do with that once it's output? I can't get it anywhere you can see it that way, cuz the computer has no network access
dcc send to me
I can't paste it!
i have to write it out manually
you should learn to cut and paste before using linux
i can not open a terminal window. i'm running straight ona command line
pay attention please
it is 30$/hr for me to pay attention
copy on CD or floppy or get creative to save some time

no network access of any kind, running without LiveCD (command line installation only), no working floppy disks, nor can it mount the floppy for some reason, no way to get it to you except typing it out manually
do whatever you have to do.. and paste it somewhere when you are done
